fields.title: Mozambique: UNHCR Protection Monitoring Report #8 (April 19, 2019)
fields.body:
Location: Mandruzi, Dondo district

Discussions: Displaced families (mainly women, some men), Vice Bairro Administrator for Mandruzi

Participants: UNHCR

Date: 19/04/2019

**General background**

The objective of the trip to Dondo was to visit the two proposed resettlement sites in the district:  
Mandruzi and Mutua and to see the progress made towards demarcation of plots. According to information from the Provincial Government, which was shared during the daily meeting with clusters

on 16 April, in Mandruzi 202 plots were demarcated, none assigned; in Mutua 154 plots were demarcated, none assigned.

**Observations**

The team drove to Mandruzi village and asked several people, including the pastor and the area community leader about the proposed resettlement site. However no-one was able to provide any information, indicating that they were not aware of plans/land allocation. The team also asked the vice Bairro administrator who appeared to know about the project but hesitated to provide exact location information when asked. He referred the team to the Bairro administrator who was absent at the time of visit. The hesitation to share information of the site location, combined with lack of knowledge from community members suggests that site may not be ready as reported.

The contact information of the Bairro administrator: Jorge Cosmo, +258 84 55 70 430 & +258 84 55 76 429.

Action: Contact INGC and propose a joint visit to the proposed resettlement sites.

source.name: UN High Commissioner for Refugees
source.longname: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
source.spanish_name: Oficina del Alto Comisionado de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados
